trial_identification.studytitle: Effect of Mupirocin in patients with refractory chronic rhinosinusitis - A prospective, randomised double-blinded controlled trial
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effect of Mupirocin on S.aureus infection in patients with refractory chronic rhinosinusitis - A prospective, randomised double-blinded controlled trial

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Studies of infection and infectious agents

interventions.interventions: Mupirocin nasal rinses, 0.05% twice daily for 4 weeks.

primaryOutcome.outcome: S.aureus infection, as assessed by endoscopically-guided nasal swab

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Signs and symptoms of chronic rhinosinusitis, as assessed by the sinonasal outcome test (SNOT-20) and the Lund-Kennedy endoscopic examination score.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients with surgically-recalcitrant, S.aureus-positive chronic rhinosinusitis
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Mupirocin allergy. Augmentin Duo allergy. Multiple bacterial species on culture. MRSA. Mupirocin-resistant S.aureus.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: We hypothesise that Mupirocin nasal rinses are more efficacious compared to placebo in patients that are bothered by persistent S.aureus infection despite complete sinus surgery.
